channel.title: What is modern poetry
channel.description:
This series presents lectures with readings of poems. It strives to discuss and define modern poetry in a non-technical way. Text is read by Professor Alan Simpson of the University of Chicago; poetry is read by members of University Radio Theatre.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Techniques of modern poetry
item.description: In this program, Professor Simpson analyzes a variety of then-current poetic techniques.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Themes and subjects in modern poetry
item.description: This program analyzes themes and subjects in mid-20th century poetry.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Themes in modern poetry
item.description: This program presents lectures on mid-20th century poetry with readings of poems.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago

item.title: Some influences on modern poetry
item.description: This program discusses some influences on modern poetry, including 17th century poets like John Donne and George Herbert.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
